meanings.definition: A curved flat piece of wood that can be thrown so that it will return to the thrower.
meanings.sent1: I watched as the boomerangs flew through the air and then came back to me.
meanings.sent2: He practiced throwing boomerangs in the park on sunny days.
meanings.sent3: The boomerangs seemed to have a mind of their own, always finding their way back.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like boomerangs, always coming back to haunt her.
meanings.sent5: The colorful boomerangs danced in the sky, a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: To have the opposite effect to what was intended.
meanings.sent1: His plan to impress her with a joke boomerangs and made her upset.
meanings.sent2: The attempt to fix the leak boomerangs and caused a flood instead.
meanings.sent3: The prank boomerangs on him, making him the laughingstock of the party.
meanings.sent4: Trying to skip breakfast boomerangs later when he feels hungry during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: His lie boomerangs back at him, leading to more trouble than he expected.
